document_data.name: Rushing Waters
document_data.level3e: {{Spell table|edition=3e|[[Druid]]|5|[[Watery death domain|Watery Death]]|4}}<ref group=note name="note1">The ''[[Spell Compendium]]'' lists ''rushing waters'' as a 4{{th}}-level druid spell of the creation-subschool. For the purpose of this wiki, the spell will be listed as a 5{{th}}-level druid spell of the summoning-subschool as written in the FR-sourcebook ''[[Underdark]]'', as it is per policy.
document_data.mainbody: '''''Rushing waters''''' was a [[conjuration]] [[spell]] that pushed creatures away with conjured [[water]].
document_data.Effects: On casting ''rushing waters'', the caster designated a point within range of the spell. From this point, water started coming out. This water violently spread in a radius of 15 feet (4,6 meters) around and pushed those who were not strong enough to withstand the wave away and possibly even dragging them off their feet.
document_data.Components: ''Rushing waters'' required only [[somatic]] and [[verbal component]]s, but also a [[divine focus]].
document_data.History: ''Rushing waters'' was a spell necessary in the [[item enchantment|creation]] of a ''[[watery grave]]'' and a spell that could be cast using the [[staff]].
